review: California Pizza Kitchen has had kind of a weird history on Guam. It opened originally like 5-6 years ago and was pretty busy when Holiday Resort was originally Holiday Inn.  Then for some reason it closed down for about 2-3 years, and then suddenly reopened a year or two ago? The rumor is that the original CPK that opened was actually an illegal copycat but now it's legit (considering it's actually listed on CPK's website).   Anyway the pizza and food have been always of good quality and pricing. And the same quality you'd expect to get stateside. Believe it or not some chains do not translate well in Guam. I.E. Pizza Hut pizza in Guam is not the same as Pizza Hut pizza in the states (it's worse), but for some reason KFC in Guam is 10x better than KFC in the states.     The 3-4 times I've been to this CPK location (2 times since it re-opened) service has always been fast and friendly. What also is pretty cool about this CPK is unlike the CPKs in the states they have coupons every now and then which make eating out at a place like this very reasonable. IE. $20 for 2 pizzas (that normally cost $12-15/each) that easily feeds 2-3 people.     If you've never been to a CPK I highly recommend the sausage pizza and the California club.  The lettuce wraps are a great appetizer as well.  I also heard great things about their mushroom pizza which I will try next time I'm there. ~G
The wait was long but i really loved their Kung Pao spaghetti. I just hope the  next time i come here our server 'll be more attentive in refilling our drinks!

One of my favorite restaurants! For an appetizer, the dynamite shrimp is amazing! I think all their pizzas tastes great, but my favorite being the BBQ chicken pizza with applewood smoked bacon. It has such a unique taste to it and I've never tasted pizza like that before. Also a huge fan of their Alfredo pasta with chicken, shrimp, or both. I pretty much order the same thing every time and it always turns out yummy!  On busy days, which is most days, it is challenging to find parking. It gets so hectic with the restaurant and hotel guests.

They are very busy around 6 in the evening so get there early.  The bar has only one TV.  They charge a 10% gratuity which is common in Guam. The prices are reasonable.  The fact they charge a $1 carry out fee while no other CPK does, keeps this place from getting a better review.

Worst service ever. Imagine getting there and being quoted 20-25 minute wait time. You keep seeing all these empty tables and they keep growing as time passes by. Why? Because they keep reserving each table that frees up for some reservation they wouldn't allow you to book when you called. So when about half the restaurant has empty seats, they finally seat you. But wait they're not done making you wait. 10 more minutes until a waiter shows up. And then it's so loud, he puts two salads on your order instead of one, gives you food without utensils or napkins or enough plates. Oh and the plates that was sitting there before? I wouldn't use them. They were dirty with food. And if that was bad enough, they run your card twice. Once at the front and once at the back, fibbing about something because they can't put together a coherent sentence why they're doing it. So now you have to check your credit card statement. And the sweet deal is that you are locked to paying 10 percent tip despite bad service from beginning to end. Pretty sure that's illegal if it was challenged in court. overall, a nightmare experience. I won't go back here again. Horrible service and oh, horrible food too.

I've been to a CPK in California. This one costs a little more (Typical of Guam) and has a little less options for pizza. However, the food and service were good. The cooking time seemed a little long, but I was in a larger group and we weren't in a hurry.

The only reason I give it a three is because I would hate for tourists to come to Guam for a short time and spend one of their meals here; I would hate for a visitor to come to Guam and visit the chains. We have great local food, but as far as chains go CPK so far is doing it right! REVIEW: The first thing that I would have to say about CPK is that if I walked into their restaurant and the only thing they had on their menu was their Thai Crunch Salad I would stay! Hands down one of my favorite salads and probably the best salad on their menu.  You cannot go wrong with any of their pizzas. I'd suggest the Wild Mushroom or Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage. I get either one depending on who I'm eating with, my vegan friend or my meat-loving mom. That's another great thing about CPK, they have something that caters to any diet. I've had their pastas before. They're delicious, but expensive...anyway CPK is not the place I come to when they crave pasta. Every time I come here the service is quick and friendly and most importantly the restaurant is clean!!! Considering the amount of people and noise CPK is actually pretty comfortable.  The first negative would have to be the parking. The parking is absolutely ridiculous. Whoever chose their location should have taken parking into consideration. The only parking available is shared by a public beach (about 10 stalls are always flooded) and although there is parking that is shared by the hotel I believe there is only ONE level of underground parking. Because parking is so bad I would have to say they're lucky they're located in a hotel in Tumon (this isn't a nod to the person who chose the location I believe they could have found somewhere in Tumon with better parking) where they can get a lot of foot traffic. However in my opinion, if you want to stay open you need to cater to your local clientele and I believe better parking would be a huge step in that direction. Another negative would be that they're always crowded. If you're not a fan of crowds or would like a more intimate setting avoid CPK. However if you have a large and loud group of people and could care less about noise well then CPK is a-okay for you! Overall, the good food, even though it is a chain, brings people back for more!
go to hawaii or the mainland to experience this restaurant. the service was AWEFUL and the menu is WAY OVERPRICED!! $50 for 2 people (pizza and appetizer) !! what the heck! unbelievable...

most the staff at the back of the house has been there since the opening and this helps on the quality assurance front! love this place because it tastes just like its supposed to taste (like how I have it when I'm in California!)  Guam, however, has a limited menu and I am still waiting for the day they will add the pear-gorgonzola pizza for service!...I'm assuming pears and gorgonzola are just too pricey in this neck of the woods.  Parking is not the most convenient because the hotel's garage is a maze and sometimes you might have to park across the street or at the adjacent Matapang beach. Very reliable and because I was part of the design team that built this place, I have to love it for the ambience, lighting, and design :)

A four star review on a chain restaurant? Seriously? Yes. CPK on Guam is great! Great wait staff, great management, clean, organized, and overall a nice place to eat. Why the four stars? Their localized foods on the menu! The Chamorro Pizza was AWESOME and I told the manager that it should be on the international menu.

2nd time here and it's the slowest most mediocre restaurant around. I've ordered to-go, showed up later than the quoted time and still waited for 25 minutes to get my food. They weren't even very crowded and staff was definitely lacking in curtesy. There are a couple of similarly mediocre pizza places near by where people are much nicer so I'd totally recommend going there instead.

The food was good as expected but what I was super impressed with was the service and teamwork shown by the employees! They were busy with multiple big parties and all the servers helped each other the whole time. We were checked on by managers 3 times, and it was an overall excellent experience. Don't find that too often on Guam.
The food quality was as expected of a CPK.  They were out of a lot of beers making the selection pretty lame.

Came in for lunch with my mom and we decided to share a couple of plates, except for a cup of tortilla soup my mom had which, she said was tasty.  So, we ordered the Thai salad, avocado and crab egg roll, and the carnitas tacos.  Although the carnitas was chunkier than how I usually like them, it was still delicious.  All of the dishes we had surpassed my expectations.  Service was wonderful.  We were greeted and seated as soon as we came in.  Our waitress was friendly and patient with us while we were trying to decide what to order.  After our orders arrived, she stopped by a couple of times to check on us and our waters, which is a big plus for me.  Also, our food came in a timely manner.
Every Time I'm here I always get the Thai Crunch Salad and the Avocado egg rolls Awesome dishes.

All I have to say is AVOCADO EGG ROLLS!! They are so delish. It is usually one of the primary things I order here. It is an appetizer that comes with two types of sauces for options in flavor. Aside from that, everything I have tried on the menu thus far is really good. My favorite pizza would be the original bbq chicken pizza and as for pasta I would go with the garlic cream fettuccine. It is a bit pricy considering how little their portion sizings are, but the food is good.  The interior gives off a warm feeling since it is a bit dim, but it is also very clean and inviting. The servers are also really nice. I would definitely recommend this place to those who want a variety in pizza and pastas. And if you are not in the mood for that they have tacos and sandwiches.

Was there with a large party of about 25. We were only given one server, so you can imagine the service we got. Everyone ordered the appetizers and beer, which took awhile to come out. The egg rolls were really good, I highly suggest them. After we order our main dish and it arrived, we were told that they were out of ingredients. We asked was this know before we ordered, and of course it was, the pizza was way over cooked but had a good taste. I would recommend this place for a small party but would advise to go somewhere with a large one.

Overpriced! We don't mind paying more but for the price they're listing, the food should be above average. We got 2 salads and avocado egg rolls, total came out to $50. The salads was nothing special and the portion was small.
Making reservations here is "useless". They don't write the correct number of people in your group!!! It's not even that hard. They need to train their staff well.
Had the BBQ chopped chicken salad and loved it.  Hubby got the BBQ pizza and that was good, too.

Prices are fair, when it's busy prepare to wait for a while. However, when I was there on 11/7/2015 at around 6pm - 8pm.... I had to wait quite a long time for my pasta. It turned out the whoever was looking at my order ticket accidentally threw away my ticket so I had to wait quite a while for it. Overall, it is still a good place to eat, that incident was only the first time I had ever had that experience versus the previous times I had eaten there. Normally it's not as busy during the times I had gone previously.
Their pizza was very good. Price of each pizza is about $12-17, and the size makes me full. Staff was very kind and nice. I can recommend it to many Japanese.
Typical CPK fare... Overpriced pizzas, salads are typically colorless. But the service is decent. Pizzas taste as good as they do in the states.

My first visit here was okay. The fried mac n cheese was delicious, but my entrée, the Jambalaya Fettuccine, was a tad too salty. It was crowded, our server was slow (took forever to bring my husband his beer) and I wasn't keen on the pricing.

Add this to your places to eat in Guam I have eaten here twice. Both times have the same Pros: - excellent staff. Friendly, attentive, know the menu well. - excellent meals. Highly recommend the chicken piccata.  - very good martinis. They need to work on the right mix, but overall very good.  - wifi; I'm a stickler for this, esp. on a business trip, and the offer it.  - excellent manager. I find a manager who actually works the floor visits tables in high regard I can see this restaurant hah taken a few hits in the past. The manager I met with, Debbie Eding took no effort to hide her knowledge of it. She welcomed reviews based on your visit today. That to me says she is not only aware of the past, but making a concerted effort to make this a 5 star enjoyment for dining.  Given that attitude, I find no cons. You will do well to visits here.

Everything is so delicious. I could easily choose something from each of their menu categories. The chicken kelaguen is a fresh take on a Chamorro classic. CPK desserts all sweet treats. Delicious food, diverse menu, friendly staff = 5 stars

Always fresh and a great variety. Hummus rules, the Miso salad rocks, and any pizza or pasta is awesome. service is a little fast between ordering and apps.  Even faster between apps and entree. No time to enjoy cocktail but that really is not an issue.
Great pizzeria for specialty pizzas with California infusion appetizers. Also service and staff is amazing.

Food is delish, but pricey!  Service could have been a bit quicker.  I don't understand why the staff are assigned based on who comes through the door, rather than an assigned area.  No wonder why they're running all over the place!

I generally enjoy CPK and there are definitely chains here that don't get it done as well their mainland counterparts but this is not one of them. Everything about it feels like CPK in California, if you like it there, you'll like it here.

We tried some new items - Chorizo Fundido Dip and California Club Pizza. We would not recommend them. The dip was okay. The cheese was kind of watery. Not a lot of chips were provided to finish the dip. I had to ask for more chips and was charged $2. This is the only restaurant that I've been to that charges for refills for chips. The pizza looked like they just poured sliced avocado and lettuce. It was not as good as their other pizzas.  The spicy seafood pasta was really good though. Not overwhelmingly spicy but with a little kick. I was disappointed that they removed the portobello mushroom ravioli from the menu. Hope they bring it back. Next time, I'll stick to ordering their older items. Their service varies from good to exceptional. So far I have not had a bad visit.
Same cozy environment and traditional Pizza, but with island flavor... I was torn between The Original BBQ or Jamaican Jerk.  I chose the JJ and it was absolutely delicious!!

Food in Guam is unexciting. My family and I eat a lot of vegetables and CPK is one of the few places that serves interesting salads that consist of more than just iceberg lettuce. We came here 2 days in a row to have some thin crust pizza and salads. The Thai salad is really good but the avocado was very bruised the second time. I like the thin crust with artichoke but the one with sausage and some sweet sauce was terrible. For some reason the artichoke pizza tasted different the second time. Like the food, the service is inconsistent. First server wasn't friendly and did not provide a bag or utensils. Second server provided everything without being asked. Food and service needs to be consistent!

Great service! But I was kinda disappointed in my order:/ We got the "Crispy Mac N' Cheese"  * our classic Mac N' Cheese lightly fried with panko, served on a creamy cheese sauce * -- please refer to my attached images on a visual of what I received. For the most part. It was spiral pasta (not the ones usually used for Mac-n-cheese) balled up into a chicken nugget form and then fried in panko. Just disappointing because our party ordered 3 orders of it and we were all disappointed:(

This is the worst place to go too. Customer service sucks. I ordered so much that my bill was over 100 dollars. As I made my way to pick it up. I had to ask for assistance several times. Once a wait staff helped me. He handed me 2 full containers of salad. With no bag and the 5 large pizzas. I had to ask for a bag just to load the salad inside. I also had to ask got forks and stuff at which they rolled their eyes like I'm nothing. I don't think you will be getting anymore orders from me. If we weren't so hungry, I would of requested to see their manager and made a complaint. But even at that their services was worse then any pizza place I have gone too. Vaca was good but this place sucks.

Average. That describes the entire meal. The 'Lunch Duo' - a house Caesar salad and 7" pepperoni pizza - wasn't bad, but neither did I think to myself, "I have to get that again." The Murphy-Goode Homefront Red was pretty good and the primary reason the rating wasn't lower.

I come to Guam at least once a year and for the last 3 years and every time I have ordered take out (4-5 times) they say 15 minutes and when I get there it is not ready! I waited 20 minutes this time and it still took over 30 minutes. They really need to organize better! I also ordered the Salted Caramel pudding for $9.00 and it is about a 1/4 cup in size. Kind of over priced!
I was sitting in the area closes to the bar!! The waiter was tall really forgot his name but he was so rude!!! Bad customer service!!

Came in today for lunch and took around 30 minutes for a salad to come. Had to ask several people for a high chair and 3 different people for refills on water because the staff wasn't very attentive. It wasn't a busy day. It's not the same flavors or menu from the CPK in the mainland and the flavor profile is definitely different and lacking. You're paying more for an okay meal that takes a long time to arrive to your table. And I love CPK and would frequently visit the restaurants in California and was never disappointed there. Guam's franchise of CPK is a disappointment.

Slightly overpriced, even for Guam. Service is usually pretty good. The Food tastes good. Takes a little while but comes out hot, third time here and usually it's the same outcome. Not a bad place to grab a bite.

CPK is ALWAYS a family favorite! We go here all the time...on Sunday's after church, lunch on a weekday, etc. We love the avocado club egg rolls, Thai crunch salad, BBQ chicken pizza, and Kung pao chicken spaghetti. Rolls are crunch on the outside, flavorful on the inside. The salads are always fresh and cool. The pizzas are hot hot hot and bursting with flavor. And the spaghetti...LOVE. Everything on that menus is absolutely great! Highly recommend!

The staff here is fantastic!! I was visiting Guam and of course I needed wifi, caffeine and air conditioning. Luckily this place has all three. I was out of it when I walked in and sat at the bar. But they kept refilling my Diet Coke in a timely fashion. Also ask your waiter/bartender for the wifi password. They will give it to you! It's a great place for a tourist!
Loved the atmosphere. Went there to celebrate and the service was okay.  Food was Delicious!  Pricey thou $$$....
I guess the food is good for what it is, but I'm not sure what it is. Doesn't taste fresh to me. And it's kind of steep. Then again, I'm a sourpuss.

I know it is a chain and I am not a huge fan of chains, but the service and food quality are ALWAYS on point.  I eat here 3 or 4 times a month and Tumon has a lot of options. Full Caesar salad with chicken is a perfect lunch and nothing satisfies a craving like the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken pizza with bacon (smash up of 2 different pizzas). The warm butter cake a la mode is perfect desert if you have already given up on worrying about calories

A lot of places on Guam aren't quite as good as their continental counterparts (chili's, ruby Tuesday), but California Pizza Kitchen is just as good. We had "the works" pizza and Thai crunch salad, both good. The prices were reasonable and the service was better than most spots on Guam. The restaurant is clean and well run. I liked it and will go back. Thanks place!

California Pizza Kitchen offers a good variety of different Pizzas and Pastas. The food is tasty at times but is never consistent. The portions are good enough for 2 but not good for a group of people. Our go to meals are BBQ chicken pizza, creamy chicken and shrimp Alfredo, lettuce wraps, and spring rolls. This place is always packed so be prepared to wait long.  Definitely a must go to if you enjoy great pizza, appetizers, and pasta.

We're staying in the attached hotel, the Holiday Resort, which I will wholeheartedly do NOT recommend and have eaten at CPK for several meals. We have eaten at various CPK locations in the states and have never really been impressed, this location is completely different! Everything is fresh and delicious. The staff is kind and attentive, even when service is super busy. The food and drinks are well priced and delicious. We have frequented the CPK several times during our stay and have never been disappointed. Definitely recommend if you're staying in the area or if you're just coming from the beach and want some good eats and good drinks in a friendly environment.

The food is great, if you get it.  The problem is your chances of getting your food are really really bad. I'm 3 for 3 not getting my food... at least not in a timely manner. FIRST TIME: I ordered a pizza and my girlfriend got a salad. The salad came out 20min after the pizza.  I can only assume they were waiting on the lettuce to ripen.   By then we had both ate the pizza together, so the salad was completely unnecessary, and a horrible leftover meal. SECOND TIME: It had been a month before we tried again.  On the first trip we got the dynamite shrimp appetizer and was dynamite, I loved it. So I figured what the hell I would go in for a drink and an app. It took over an hour to get our app after ordering. I can only speculate that they we're trying to get me to order more of they're over priced drinks.  THIRD TIME: It had been a few months since the last ordeal and I had a gift certificate, so let's try one more time! I figured I would go in at the end of lunch time when they were slower than dinner time, what the heck...it could not happen three times and that shrimp is really good! I was wrong! I started with the shrimp, it came out quickly and it was great. Finished it and after my 3rd iced tea (30-40min after ordering) I'm just thinking "This can't really be happening again!!" I ask the waiter if there is something wrong. He explained that the other server had given my pizza to the wrong table. I look over to see them eating my pizza as well as receiving their pizza order. WTF? This is a chain restaurant and I can't imagine this standard being acceptable.  In the managers defense- I wasn't charged for the shrimp or iced tea- but left still hungry for lunch and very frustrated. This place is seriously jacked up. They are creating a horrible reputation for all the CPKs. And honestly I think I will not be using my gift certificate. It's just not worth it.

Only ate here once so maybe I just had bad luck. I went during hours in between lunch and dinner so it wasn't very busy. Service was ok. My pizza arrived and it wasn't hot. For how long it took I could tell the pizza was not cooked to order. It tasted ok but probably would have been decent if cooked fresh.

We tried some new items - Chorizo Fundido Dip and California Club Pizza. We would not recommend them. The dip was okay. The cheese was kind of watery. Not a lot of chips were provided to finish the dip. I had to ask for more chips and was charged $2. This is the only restaurant that I've been to that charges for refills for chips. The pizza looked like they just poured sliced avocado and lettuce. It was not as good as their other pizzas.  The spicy seafood pasta was really good though. Not overwhelmingly spicy but with a little kick. I was disappointed that they removed the portobello mushroom ravioli from the menu. Hope they bring it back. Next time, I'll stick to ordering their older items. Their service varies from good to exceptional. So far I have not had a bad visit.
Same cozy environment and traditional Pizza, but with island flavor... I was torn between The Original BBQ or Jamaican Jerk.  I chose the JJ and it was absolutely delicious!!

Food in Guam is unexciting. My family and I eat a lot of vegetables and CPK is one of the few places that serves interesting salads that consist of more than just iceberg lettuce. We came here 2 days in a row to have some thin crust pizza and salads. The Thai salad is really good but the avocado was very bruised the second time. I like the thin crust with artichoke but the one with sausage and some sweet sauce was terrible. For some reason the artichoke pizza tasted different the second time. Like the food, the service is inconsistent. First server wasn't friendly and did not provide a bag or utensils. Second server provided everything without being asked. Food and service needs to be consistent!

Great service! But I was kinda disappointed in my order:/ We got the "Crispy Mac N' Cheese"  * our classic Mac N' Cheese lightly fried with panko, served on a creamy cheese sauce * -- please refer to my attached images on a visual of what I received. For the most part. It was spiral pasta (not the ones usually used for Mac-n-cheese) balled up into a chicken nugget form and then fried in panko. Just disappointing because our party ordered 3 orders of it and we were all disappointed:(

This is the worst place to go too. Customer service sucks. I ordered so much that my bill was over 100 dollars. As I made my way to pick it up. I had to ask for assistance several times. Once a wait staff helped me. He handed me 2 full containers of salad. With no bag and the 5 large pizzas. I had to ask for a bag just to load the salad inside. I also had to ask got forks and stuff at which they rolled their eyes like I'm nothing. I don't think you will be getting anymore orders from me. If we weren't so hungry, I would of requested to see their manager and made a complaint. But even at that their services was worse then any pizza place I have gone too. Vaca was good but this place sucks.

Average. That describes the entire meal. The 'Lunch Duo' - a house Caesar salad and 7" pepperoni pizza - wasn't bad, but neither did I think to myself, "I have to get that again." The Murphy-Goode Homefront Red was pretty good and the primary reason the rating wasn't lower.

I come to Guam at least once a year and for the last 3 years and every time I have ordered take out (4-5 times) they say 15 minutes and when I get there it is not ready! I waited 20 minutes this time and it still took over 30 minutes. They really need to organize better! I also ordered the Salted Caramel pudding for $9.00 and it is about a 1/4 cup in size. Kind of over priced!
I was sitting in the area closes to the bar!! The waiter was tall really forgot his name but he was so rude!!! Bad customer service!!

Came in today for lunch and took around 30 minutes for a salad to come. Had to ask several people for a high chair and 3 different people for refills on water because the staff wasn't very attentive. It wasn't a busy day. It's not the same flavors or menu from the CPK in the mainland and the flavor profile is definitely different and lacking. You're paying more for an okay meal that takes a long time to arrive to your table. And I love CPK and would frequently visit the restaurants in California and was never disappointed there. Guam's franchise of CPK is a disappointment.

Slightly overpriced, even for Guam. Service is usually pretty good. The Food tastes good. Takes a little while but comes out hot, third time here and usually it's the same outcome. Not a bad place to grab a bite.

CPK is ALWAYS a family favorite! We go here all the time...on Sunday's after church, lunch on a weekday, etc. We love the avocado club egg rolls, Thai crunch salad, BBQ chicken pizza, and Kung pao chicken spaghetti. Rolls are crunch on the outside, flavorful on the inside. The salads are always fresh and cool. The pizzas are hot hot hot and bursting with flavor. And the spaghetti...LOVE. Everything on that menus is absolutely great! Highly recommend!

The staff here is fantastic!! I was visiting Guam and of course I needed wifi, caffeine and air conditioning. Luckily this place has all three. I was out of it when I walked in and sat at the bar. But they kept refilling my Diet Coke in a timely fashion. Also ask your waiter/bartender for the wifi password. They will give it to you! It's a great place for a tourist!
Loved the atmosphere. Went there to celebrate and the service was okay.  Food was Delicious!  Pricey thou $$$....
I guess the food is good for what it is, but I'm not sure what it is. Doesn't taste fresh to me. And it's kind of steep. Then again, I'm a sourpuss.

I know it is a chain and I am not a huge fan of chains, but the service and food quality are ALWAYS on point.  I eat here 3 or 4 times a month and Tumon has a lot of options. Full Caesar salad with chicken is a perfect lunch and nothing satisfies a craving like the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken pizza with bacon (smash up of 2 different pizzas). The warm butter cake a la mode is perfect desert if you have already given up on worrying about calories

A lot of places on Guam aren't quite as good as their continental counterparts (chili's, ruby Tuesday), but California Pizza Kitchen is just as good. We had "the works" pizza and Thai crunch salad, both good. The prices were reasonable and the service was better than most spots on Guam. The restaurant is clean and well run. I liked it and will go back. Thanks place!

California Pizza Kitchen offers a good variety of different Pizzas and Pastas. The food is tasty at times but is never consistent. The portions are good enough for 2 but not good for a group of people. Our go to meals are BBQ chicken pizza, creamy chicken and shrimp Alfredo, lettuce wraps, and spring rolls. This place is always packed so be prepared to wait long.  Definitely a must go to if you enjoy great pizza, appetizers, and pasta.

We're staying in the attached hotel, the Holiday Resort, which I will wholeheartedly do NOT recommend and have eaten at CPK for several meals. We have eaten at various CPK locations in the states and have never really been impressed, this location is completely different! Everything is fresh and delicious. The staff is kind and attentive, even when service is super busy. The food and drinks are well priced and delicious. We have frequented the CPK several times during our stay and have never been disappointed. Definitely recommend if you're staying in the area or if you're just coming from the beach and want some good eats and good drinks in a friendly environment.

The food is great, if you get it.  The problem is your chances of getting your food are really really bad. I'm 3 for 3 not getting my food... at least not in a timely manner. FIRST TIME: I ordered a pizza and my girlfriend got a salad. The salad came out 20min after the pizza.  I can only assume they were waiting on the lettuce to ripen.   By then we had both ate the pizza together, so the salad was completely unnecessary, and a horrible leftover meal. SECOND TIME: It had been a month before we tried again.  On the first trip we got the dynamite shrimp appetizer and was dynamite, I loved it. So I figured what the hell I would go in for a drink and an app. It took over an hour to get our app after ordering. I can only speculate that they we're trying to get me to order more of they're over priced drinks.  THIRD TIME: It had been a few months since the last ordeal and I had a gift certificate, so let's try one more time! I figured I would go in at the end of lunch time when they were slower than dinner time, what the heck...it could not happen three times and that shrimp is really good! I was wrong! I started with the shrimp, it came out quickly and it was great. Finished it and after my 3rd iced tea (30-40min after ordering) I'm just thinking "This can't really be happening again!!" I ask the waiter if there is something wrong. He explained that the other server had given my pizza to the wrong table. I look over to see them eating my pizza as well as receiving their pizza order. WTF? This is a chain restaurant and I can't imagine this standard being acceptable.  In the managers defense- I wasn't charged for the shrimp or iced tea- but left still hungry for lunch and very frustrated. This place is seriously jacked up. They are creating a horrible reputation for all the CPKs. And honestly I think I will not be using my gift certificate. It's just not worth it.

Only ate here once so maybe I just had bad luck. I went during hours in between lunch and dinner so it wasn't very busy. Service was ok. My pizza arrived and it wasn't hot. For how long it took I could tell the pizza was not cooked to order. It tasted ok but probably would have been decent if cooked fresh.

2nd time here and it's the slowest most mediocre restaurant around. I've ordered to-go, showed up later than the quoted time and still waited for 25 minutes to get my food. They weren't even very crowded and staff was definitely lacking in curtesy. There are a couple of similarly mediocre pizza places near by where people are much nicer so I'd totally recommend going there instead.

The food was good as expected but what I was super impressed with was the service and teamwork shown by the employees! They were busy with multiple big parties and all the servers helped each other the whole time. We were checked on by managers 3 times, and it was an overall excellent experience. Don't find that too often on Guam.
The food quality was as expected of a CPK.  They were out of a lot of beers making the selection pretty lame.

Came in for lunch with my mom and we decided to share a couple of plates, except for a cup of tortilla soup my mom had which, she said was tasty.  So, we ordered the Thai salad, avocado and crab egg roll, and the carnitas tacos.  Although the carnitas was chunkier than how I usually like them, it was still delicious.  All of the dishes we had surpassed my expectations.  Service was wonderful.  We were greeted and seated as soon as we came in.  Our waitress was friendly and patient with us while we were trying to decide what to order.  After our orders arrived, she stopped by a couple of times to check on us and our waters, which is a big plus for me.  Also, our food came in a timely manner.
Every Time I'm here I always get the Thai Crunch Salad and the Avocado egg rolls Awesome dishes.

All I have to say is AVOCADO EGG ROLLS!! They are so delish. It is usually one of the primary things I order here. It is an appetizer that comes with two types of sauces for options in flavor. Aside from that, everything I have tried on the menu thus far is really good. My favorite pizza would be the original bbq chicken pizza and as for pasta I would go with the garlic cream fettuccine. It is a bit pricy considering how little their portion sizings are, but the food is good.  The interior gives off a warm feeling since it is a bit dim, but it is also very clean and inviting. The servers are also really nice. I would definitely recommend this place to those who want a variety in pizza and pastas. And if you are not in the mood for that they have tacos and sandwiches.

Was there with a large party of about 25. We were only given one server, so you can imagine the service we got. Everyone ordered the appetizers and beer, which took awhile to come out. The egg rolls were really good, I highly suggest them. After we order our main dish and it arrived, we were told that they were out of ingredients. We asked was this know before we ordered, and of course it was, the pizza was way over cooked but had a good taste. I would recommend this place for a small party but would advise to go somewhere with a large one.

Overpriced! We don't mind paying more but for the price they're listing, the food should be above average. We got 2 salads and avocado egg rolls, total came out to $50. The salads was nothing special and the portion was small.
Making reservations here is "useless". They don't write the correct number of people in your group!!! It's not even that hard. They need to train their staff well.
Had the BBQ chopped chicken salad and loved it.  Hubby got the BBQ pizza and that was good, too.

Prices are fair, when it's busy prepare to wait for a while. However, when I was there on 11/7/2015 at around 6pm - 8pm.... I had to wait quite a long time for my pasta. It turned out the whoever was looking at my order ticket accidentally threw away my ticket so I had to wait quite a while for it. Overall, it is still a good place to eat, that incident was only the first time I had ever had that experience versus the previous times I had eaten there. Normally it's not as busy during the times I had gone previously.
Their pizza was very good. Price of each pizza is about $12-17, and the size makes me full. Staff was very kind and nice. I can recommend it to many Japanese.
Typical CPK fare... Overpriced pizzas, salads are typically colorless. But the service is decent. Pizzas taste as good as they do in the states.

My first visit here was okay. The fried mac n cheese was delicious, but my entrée, the Jambalaya Fettuccine, was a tad too salty. It was crowded, our server was slow (took forever to bring my husband his beer) and I wasn't keen on the pricing.

Add this to your places to eat in Guam I have eaten here twice. Both times have the same Pros: - excellent staff. Friendly, attentive, know the menu well. - excellent meals. Highly recommend the chicken piccata.  - very good martinis. They need to work on the right mix, but overall very good.  - wifi; I'm a stickler for this, esp. on a business trip, and the offer it.  - excellent manager. I find a manager who actually works the floor visits tables in high regard I can see this restaurant hah taken a few hits in the past. The manager I met with, Debbie Eding took no effort to hide her knowledge of it. She welcomed reviews based on your visit today. That to me says she is not only aware of the past, but making a concerted effort to make this a 5 star enjoyment for dining.  Given that attitude, I find no cons. You will do well to visits here.

Everything is so delicious. I could easily choose something from each of their menu categories. The chicken kelaguen is a fresh take on a Chamorro classic. CPK desserts all sweet treats. Delicious food, diverse menu, friendly staff = 5 stars

Always fresh and a great variety. Hummus rules, the Miso salad rocks, and any pizza or pasta is awesome. service is a little fast between ordering and apps.  Even faster between apps and entree. No time to enjoy cocktail but that really is not an issue.
Great pizzeria for specialty pizzas with California infusion appetizers. Also service and staff is amazing.

Food is delish, but pricey!  Service could have been a bit quicker.  I don't understand why the staff are assigned based on who comes through the door, rather than an assigned area.  No wonder why they're running all over the place!

I generally enjoy CPK and there are definitely chains here that don't get it done as well their mainland counterparts but this is not one of them. Everything about it feels like CPK in California, if you like it there, you'll like it here.

California Pizza Kitchen has had kind of a weird history on Guam. It opened originally like 5-6 years ago and was pretty busy when Holiday Resort was originally Holiday Inn.  Then for some reason it closed down for about 2-3 years, and then suddenly reopened a year or two ago? The rumor is that the original CPK that opened was actually an illegal copycat but now it's legit (considering it's actually listed on CPK's website).   Anyway the pizza and food have been always of good quality and pricing. And the same quality you'd expect to get stateside. Believe it or not some chains do not translate well in Guam. I.E. Pizza Hut pizza in Guam is not the same as Pizza Hut pizza in the states (it's worse), but for some reason KFC in Guam is 10x better than KFC in the states.     The 3-4 times I've been to this CPK location (2 times since it re-opened) service has always been fast and friendly. What also is pretty cool about this CPK is unlike the CPKs in the states they have coupons every now and then which make eating out at a place like this very reasonable. IE. $20 for 2 pizzas (that normally cost $12-15/each) that easily feeds 2-3 people.     If you've never been to a CPK I highly recommend the sausage pizza and the California club.  The lettuce wraps are a great appetizer as well.  I also heard great things about their mushroom pizza which I will try next time I'm there. ~G
The wait was long but i really loved their Kung Pao spaghetti. I just hope the  next time i come here our server 'll be more attentive in refilling our drinks!

One of my favorite restaurants! For an appetizer, the dynamite shrimp is amazing! I think all their pizzas tastes great, but my favorite being the BBQ chicken pizza with applewood smoked bacon. It has such a unique taste to it and I've never tasted pizza like that before. Also a huge fan of their Alfredo pasta with chicken, shrimp, or both. I pretty much order the same thing every time and it always turns out yummy!  On busy days, which is most days, it is challenging to find parking. It gets so hectic with the restaurant and hotel guests.

They are very busy around 6 in the evening so get there early.  The bar has only one TV.  They charge a 10% gratuity which is common in Guam. The prices are reasonable.  The fact they charge a $1 carry out fee while no other CPK does, keeps this place from getting a better review.

Worst service ever. Imagine getting there and being quoted 20-25 minute wait time. You keep seeing all these empty tables and they keep growing as time passes by. Why? Because they keep reserving each table that frees up for some reservation they wouldn't allow you to book when you called. So when about half the restaurant has empty seats, they finally seat you. But wait they're not done making you wait. 10 more minutes until a waiter shows up. And then it's so loud, he puts two salads on your order instead of one, gives you food without utensils or napkins or enough plates. Oh and the plates that was sitting there before? I wouldn't use them. They were dirty with food. And if that was bad enough, they run your card twice. Once at the front and once at the back, fibbing about something because they can't put together a coherent sentence why they're doing it. So now you have to check your credit card statement. And the sweet deal is that you are locked to paying 10 percent tip despite bad service from beginning to end. Pretty sure that's illegal if it was challenged in court. overall, a nightmare experience. I won't go back here again. Horrible service and oh, horrible food too.

I've been to a CPK in California. This one costs a little more (Typical of Guam) and has a little less options for pizza. However, the food and service were good. The cooking time seemed a little long, but I was in a larger group and we weren't in a hurry.

The only reason I give it a three is because I would hate for tourists to come to Guam for a short time and spend one of their meals here; I would hate for a visitor to come to Guam and visit the chains. We have great local food, but as far as chains go CPK so far is doing it right! REVIEW: The first thing that I would have to say about CPK is that if I walked into their restaurant and the only thing they had on their menu was their Thai Crunch Salad I would stay! Hands down one of my favorite salads and probably the best salad on their menu.  You cannot go wrong with any of their pizzas. I'd suggest the Wild Mushroom or Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage. I get either one depending on who I'm eating with, my vegan friend or my meat-loving mom. That's another great thing about CPK, they have something that caters to any diet. I've had their pastas before. They're delicious, but expensive...anyway CPK is not the place I come to when they crave pasta. Every time I come here the service is quick and friendly and most importantly the restaurant is clean!!! Considering the amount of people and noise CPK is actually pretty comfortable.  The first negative would have to be the parking. The parking is absolutely ridiculous. Whoever chose their location should have taken parking into consideration. The only parking available is shared by a public beach (about 10 stalls are always flooded) and although there is parking that is shared by the hotel I believe there is only ONE level of underground parking. Because parking is so bad I would have to say they're lucky they're located in a hotel in Tumon (this isn't a nod to the person who chose the location I believe they could have found somewhere in Tumon with better parking) where they can get a lot of foot traffic. However in my opinion, if you want to stay open you need to cater to your local clientele and I believe better parking would be a huge step in that direction. Another negative would be that they're always crowded. If you're not a fan of crowds or would like a more intimate setting avoid CPK. However if you have a large and loud group of people and could care less about noise well then CPK is a-okay for you! Overall, the good food, even though it is a chain, brings people back for more!
go to hawaii or the mainland to experience this restaurant. the service was AWEFUL and the menu is WAY OVERPRICED!! $50 for 2 people (pizza and appetizer) !! what the heck! unbelievable...

most the staff at the back of the house has been there since the opening and this helps on the quality assurance front! love this place because it tastes just like its supposed to taste (like how I have it when I'm in California!)  Guam, however, has a limited menu and I am still waiting for the day they will add the pear-gorgonzola pizza for service!...I'm assuming pears and gorgonzola are just too pricey in this neck of the woods.  Parking is not the most convenient because the hotel's garage is a maze and sometimes you might have to park across the street or at the adjacent Matapang beach. Very reliable and because I was part of the design team that built this place, I have to love it for the ambience, lighting, and design :)

A four star review on a chain restaurant? Seriously? Yes. CPK on Guam is great! Great wait staff, great management, clean, organized, and overall a nice place to eat. Why the four stars? Their localized foods on the menu! The Chamorro Pizza was AWESOME and I told the manager that it should be on the international menu.
